nodes.bodyText: Can we safely delete the argument in 4.3? That's probably a question on MC forward-compatibility with IMDG.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -36,4 +34,26 @@
     BOOLEAN,
     /** 0..n, ordinal of an enum */
     ENUM,
+    /** Timestamp or duration represented in µs */
+    // RU_COMPAT_4_2
+    // remove constructor argument in 4.3

nodes.bodyText: I think if MC handles the units as @emre commented, we can delete the argument safely.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -36,4 +34,26 @@
     BOOLEAN,
     /** 0..n, ordinal of an enum */
     ENUM,
+    /** Timestamp or duration represented in µs */
+    // RU_COMPAT_4_2
+    // remove constructor argument in 4.3

nodes.bodyText: I considered the same question and I think yes. We will upgrade MC to latest minor release when it comes out.

nodes.bodyText: nit: I'd also add a note to the enum javadoc. The text could be Note. The order of enum ordinals is important for compatibility purposes with potential metrics consumers. Do not delete existing value and always add new ones to the end of the list. or smth like that.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -36,4 +34,26 @@
     BOOLEAN,
     /** 0..n, ordinal of an enum */
     ENUM,
+    /** Timestamp or duration represented in µs */
+    // RU_COMPAT_4_2
+    // remove constructor argument in 4.3
+    US(true);

nodes.bodyText: Thanks for the comment, added the above roles to the javadoc of the enum.
